page.title: 11TRANSPORT
page.content: Two of the bus services through West Linton to Edinburgh are from Biggar and Dumfries. Some of the buses are routed through Penicuik-a nearby town. There are only two return buses a week to Peebles on Tuesday and Friday morning. These are privately owned. One of the two buses that takes the pupils to Peebles High School during the week is a regular service bus supplied by the Eastern Scottish bus company. Passengers can use it in the mornings and evenings . There is little demand for buses to Peebles as few people work there . Edinburgh has many more shops with greater variety than Peebles. Trains were discontinued in 1934 and the demand for buses is not very high as most people have their own cars which they use to travel into Edinburgh to work.
